noun.description: A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef.

examples: what does he see in that cow?

verb.description: Cause (someone) to submit to one's wishes by intimidation.
examples: the intellectuals had been cowed into silence

phrases: don't have a cow—it's no big deal
People would, well, have a cow, and for good reason.
I'm in there for forty-five minutes and you start to have a cow!
Her sister did the same thing and you didn't have a cow.
Aunt Beth is having a cow about the messes I always make.
origin: Late 16th century: probably from Old Norse kúga oppress.
